title: CNH Industrial CEO Richard Tobin steps down
text: March 19, 2018 / 9:39 PM / Updated an hour ago CNH Industrial CEO Richard Tobin steps down Reuters Staff 1 Min Read (Reuters) - Truck and tractor maker CNH Industrial said on Monday Chief Executive Richard Tobin would step down to pursue another executive opportunity and its board has appointed Derek Neilson to replace him in the interim. Neilson was most recently chief operating officer for EMEA and was the president of the company’s commercial vehicles products segment. The company, created from the merger of Fiat Industrial and its U.S. unit CNH, said Tobin’s departure would be effective April 27, 2018, after announcing financial results for the fiscal quarter ending March 31, 2018. Tobin had been at the helm since January 2012. Reporting by Rama Venkat Raman in Bengaluru; Editing by Alison Williams
